event.name: DOOR_OPEN_SONG_NEW
event.text: Before stepping on board however, the Lizard begins to do a chant, dancing around in circles. "Tunt parra parra, kaethlu parra parra, spaekith parra parra, taklu parra parra! Parra maku!" After finishing, they pause and look at you.

"This is Door Open song! Lizard culture involves many dances and chants. In the way you knock on door for entry, we dance the Door Open Song! It is a song for both requesting faithful entry, and for giving thanks for granting it. Very sacred, very important."
The lizard hangs its head, dejected, but says no more.

event.name: DOOR_OPEN_SONG_GUNTPUT_NEW
event.text: "Federation. You have done good service for my people. I do not foresee... good future for them. But still better than in Hektar labor camp for rest of days. I will not go with them. I have failed them. I will serve you instead, in efforts to save reality and someday free rest of my people." As Guntput steps aboard your ship, he raises his spear and shakes it twice, chanting a strange song while dancing around in circles. "Tunt parra parra, kaethlu parra parra, spaekith parra parra, taklu parra parra! Parra maku!" After finishing, he pauses and looks at you.

"This is Door Open song. Lizard culture involves many dances and chants. In the way you knock on door for entry, we dance the Door Open Song! It is a song for both requesting faithful entry, and for giving thanks for granting it. Very sacred, very important."
"Very well. I will be a good staying guest. But do not disappoint me, as I have disappointed my people."
"What? Really? You are really refusing? And to think I started liking you. Hmph."

"Oh... er... the Door Open Song. I think. It's uh... a lizard thing. Request for entry or whatever. Just say yes and let's get it over with."
"Right, right. Sorry about that. Just some dumb tradition. You know how those things are. Or maybe you don't, we only just met."
"Oh? Oh well. I can't say I'm surprised, but I am... uh... confused?"

event.name: THE_JUDGES_NEW
event.text: A strange vessel approaches, and on your screen appears three aliens dressed in long robes and their faces covered with ornate masks. The first, a Zoltan, speaks. "Hello. We are... the Observers. Maybe, long ago... we have met. Maybe not. We do not recall. But now, we have returned. We seek knowledge. You seek... what do you seek? We will find out, yes?"

"Allow us to get... introductions out of the way. I am Thest, Judge of Diplomacy. I seek... travelers who make it their passion to make peace with all species. Prove to me your... dedication to building bridges and I shall grant you... great boons."

The second judge, a Separatist, appears next. "[Hail], for I am: Corby - Judge of Technology. Judge of Technology! Mission of observation summary: analyze trends between travelers with [advanced] technology. Technology! Do you -possess- t-t-t-technology? Of the advanced form? Provide proof. Rewards await. Rewards await!"

The final judge, a Rockman with the marks of a former Lost Sun commando, speaks last. "I am WAKESON, Judge of WARFARE! A MILITARY VESSEL such as yours would not befit to be seen without an ARSENAL fit for a KING! Do not DISAPPOINT me, for great rewards await those WORTHY of my time!"

The three, finished, each take a bow. "Good." "F-f-fantastic!" "Hmph."
"We have reached a consensus. You are our... latest subject." "[You] bring us: tribute!" "We will OBSERVE! IMPRESS he or she who you THINK BEST suits your purposes." "Yes... the data will be... invaluable. We understand at this time you are... unprepared." "-Yes-. As consolation, we offer: gift. Monetary supplement. We share the [desire] to see you again. We will: see you again." "Now LEAVE. Your time will COME AGAIN."

event.name: THE_JUDGES_CHAOS
event.text: A strange vessel approaches, and on your screen appears three aliens dressed in long robes and their faces covered with ornate masks. "We apologize... traveler. We had a whole... introduction planned, and... so much more we wanted to... say. But unfortunately, we have received... notice that this reality must be... abandoned."

choice.text: Does it have something to do with this gnome?

event.text: "Where did you... get this? The one in the... suit warned us that... some fool had brought with them an... anomalous object of immense threat and power." "This was a [very] unwise d-d-d-d-decision! Do you even un-un-un-understand what that Gnome does? What that Gnome does?! It must be b-b-bad to scare the [man] in the suit so much!" "You blasphemous FOOL. Had the creed not FORBIDDEN us from chastizing you further, I would RIP your limbs ASUNDER."

choice.text: Do you know what this gnome is?

event.text: "Only... barely. The creed... forbids us from discussing such matters, but from our time... well... in the place we used to get here... we heard some details." "Yes, it is true. True! The C.E.L - Oh... my bad! Bad! I should not have s-s-said -that-." The three figures stop and huddle together to talk amongst themselves.

"Our friend Corby has MISPOKE. Ignore her ERROR. We advise you do not CONTINUE to PLAY with things like these. It seems we must ABANDON this reality immediately, and so we will ACCEPT no other tributes at this time." The Zoltan nods. "Well... I see no reason not to... at least record this... And as such... I will consider it tribute, and with it... a very special boon. The Boon of Chaos. Use it... wisely. Goodbye, traveler."

"Yes, but do not... fear for it. I'm sure there are... protocols in place for you as... well. But for now, before we go... would you like our... services? Show us your... best tribute, and we may be able to provide you... unique rewards."

event.text: "That is... disappointing, though it is... understandable. Well, then I suppose we have... no more business here. Farewell, traveler..."

event.name: THE_JUDGES_ZOLTAN
event.text: Thest bows. "I see you seek my... boons. But first... your proof. Present to me the crewmember you are... most proud of recruiting."

"The failed... experiments of the Geniocracy. The strange language these... creatures speak is most undecipherable. To welcome one aboard your ship is... impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"An arachnid... dubiously named by humans. Barely sapient... maybe not even so. Under your care it seems... satisfied. To control even temporarily such a usually savage and disobedient creature is... impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A strange creature... of unknown origins, but they have spread like a... virus across the galaxy. When domesticated they can be... useful. I suppose I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"Servants to... Hektar Industries. Enslaved, belittled... they trust not technology. Corby would... disapprove, but I myself see it as an... accomplishment to convince one to work with you. It is... impressive, you could say. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"..."
Thest remains silent momentarily.
"Yes... my... people... Hmmm... Is... impressed the word I would... use? Maybe. I suppose a reward is... in order... This is certainly... data. It would be... disappointing for me to turn down... tribute. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A heretical splinter group... they seek the wisdom of some higher plane... yet the Ember does not reside with you. To have convinced this stubborn follower of a stringent faith is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The mechanic offspring of the... Obelisk. Abused by their masters, they resent... authority. You are either a cruel slaver master... or a forgiving and benevolent captain. But... what is the difference in the end? To recruit such an... exotic crew member is most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The... Augmented. Lanius who have followed in the footsteps of their... Forefathers. No longer one with the Swarm, they are... exceedingly rare to come across. You have a... long reaching influence to have one of these aboard your crew. It is... impressive. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The Obelisk... my word... how unexpected. The founders of this galaxy, the closest thing to gods we have... ever had. Well... besides... him... Nevermatter. To carry aboard your vessel an... Obelisk is most impressive. I am... very impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A well trained... human. While their species is often seen as... common and uninteresting... recruiting one of such expertise is... impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The faithful... to their paycheck, at least... employees of Wentworth Innovations. Their original employer is certainly no... friend of yours, but to carry them aboard your ship is... impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The chosen protectors of the... Harmony. Yes... the Harmony does not often allow its soldiers aboard... strange vessels such as yours. The lengths you must have gone to recruit this Engi are... impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"Guardians of the... Ministry. There is some... irony to their ruthlessness... but the Ministry has always been a well of paradox. It is hard to... impress a Peacekeeper. Just, as it is hard... to impress me. Yet, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The ruthless, devoted, and far from benevolent Martyrs... you, a Federation ally, harbor their most devoted. A Martyr, one who would... die for the cause... has betrayed it to aid you. This is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The stalwart Praetors, humble protectors of the... Gardenworlds. This one appears to have... abandoned its post to aid you. That is... most impressive. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The mutated brainchildren of... Alkali. They are not known to care... for ideals or causes. Yet this one has decided to aid... yours. That is... most impressive. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A warrior of such fine caliber... a sworn enemy of the Federation. Yet, it has left the Hive, and is now in your... service? This is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The Free Mantis are an... enigmatic problem. Unpredictable, unintelligent... unwashed and unaware. To possess such control over such an... unregulated beast... a mindless murderer... is... impressive? I think it is... I will accept this tribute, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The elusive Saboteurs - Clairvoyants, hackers, Coalition spies... none are your allies... except this one. Either it seeks... to rob your wallet, or it has found a friend in you. I will be generous and assume... the latter. This is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The finest sharpshooters in the... multiverse. Hunters, most devoted to their craft. For one to leave the vantage of their Guild, it suggests... it has found better use in you. A most utilitarian of professions, surely this implies impressive things of your... prowess. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A religious juggernaut... in all senses of the word. Their beliefs are as unmoving as... they are. Yet, you have... moved them. An impressive... feat. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A Sentinel... the proud defenders of the... Crystalline Empire's new homeworlds. They are not always the most... recipient to outsiders, but you seem to have convinced this one to... aid you. This is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The toxic Radiant... a marvel of Dr. Alkali's finest genetic engineering. Though created for unwavering... service, it seems this one has found you a better... employer. This is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"How... electrifying. The parasitic Amperes, the Coalition's finest... born from the ruined waysides of the Eargen Republic and smithed into... a noble warrior. An expert on the best and the worst... for an Ampere to call you master you must be a most... impressive captain. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"Gaseous beings of undecipherable biology... and also undecipherable motives. Dynasty or Vagabond, Phantoms are not easily swayed to the side of... well... the likes of you. And for Alphas, this statement is imbued with an even... greater truth. To recruit one is... most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"Perhaps some of the... oldest beings alive. Near immortal, and empowered by it, the Welders have seen all. Burdened with the witnessing of... millennia old evils, there must be a great... potential in you for one to fly in your ranks... Most impressive. Yes, I am... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The Rebellion's finest... the wits of a Slug, quicker than a Mantis, and a relentless and unbreakable jingoist that even a Duskbringer would view extreme... How ever could you have... recruited it? No... this is not my place to ask questions. Your tribute is... very impressive. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"I find it... ironic... the petty feuds between the Renegades and the Syndicate. With the same vigor, the same pride of their leader Vael... hmmm... the Angels would not follow your command unless you were truly worthy... a worthiness which leaves me most... impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"For how many have fallen at the hands of this Bishop... easily you could have been another. And yet, here you stand, and this Bishop... they follow your command. I marvel at the lengths you must have gone to... achieve this. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"The most cunning of all the Slugs... the Knights of Nights represent the finest... the poster children of every virtue - and vice - the Slugs hold dear. Such crew could be considered an... indictment... but I am nothing but impressed. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"It is not difficult to confuse the... Chrysolic clergymen as... brutish soldiers. But the Paladins are... far from unintelligent. What they are, however... is undyingly loyal. To sway one to your side says nothing short of the mastery in diplomatic skill you possess. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"A... prestigious face, one surely recognized... to recruit such a notable figure, one of such... distinction, is a most impressive act. Yes, this tribute is... very impressive. Well done, traveler. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"I... this is... How unexpected. I was not sure... this cluster... nevermind. Do me a favor, would you, and avoid... showing this to Corby? I cannot explain for the... creed forbids me, but it is... for the best. Yes... a good tribute is in store for this. Expect... rewards before your next journey."

"I... wh..." Thest stops entirely as he processes the pile of corpses on the ground before him. "Uhm... this is... tribute? You are... sure? Okay... I hesitate to say... well done. But... I suppose you can... expect some reward for your next journey... Now... please leave."
"Really? You have brought... nothing? Pity. I had such... high hopes. This will not... do. Next time I advise... bringing something worth showing, yes?"

textList.name: TEXT_JUDGE_ZOLTAN_ADVICE
textList.text: "Oh and... before you go... allow me to impart some wisdom. The Multiverse is much... bigger than just your cluster. We are not the lone entities to have taken... interest in your home. Matters of great import are... staked upon the fate of your cluster. I hope you will... some day understand what is at... stake. That is... all... Goodbye, traveler."

"Oh and... might I ask a... favor of you, traveler? That... Traveling Merchant. The one who calls himself... Sylvan. Would you perhaps... keep a careful eye on him? I know he is... a bountiful ally of yours but... well... I am not at the liberty to say. Oh well. Heed my advice, if you... wish. That is all."

"I've taken a recent interest in a certain... conflict in my homeworlds. Well... the version of them in this cluster, that is... I advise you, if you happen to travel there... well... see to it your tracking systems are... up to par? Understand? If not, perhaps you will... some day."

"Your cluster is... so strange... It is against the creed to... speak of our home... but... no. I must never break the... creed. Maybe... maybe Corby will tell you... she cares less for... rules... Maybe too little..."

"I must... warn you, traveler. I fear something dangerous brews... and you must stop it before it is... too late. Am I being... too cryptic? Perhaps. But the creed... the creed says I must. We already do too much, by intervening. These... boons. Are they even allowed? We were sent to collect data... our justification was for an incentive... I must not question myself. I do what I must... We all do."

"Be cautious... this multiverse contains many vices for the... hungry. Magnets of sin... the tempation is often far too... great. I fell for those mistakes... once. Do not follow in my... footsteps, traveler."

"I hope our... appearances do not put you on... edge... We are... peaceful. Or at least, I can ensure you that I am... and Corby too. As for Wakeson... well... he has endured pain as bitter as the rest of us... but unlike Corby, whose unrelenting optimism acts as a... torch through her dark past... it is Wakeson's... fighting spirit that is his torch. And as a once Lost Sun, in his hands a torch is... quite the weapon..."

"I often lose... track... of how many travelers I have met. So many... so many... what number are you? It is... strange... you all seem so similar. You become... a blur. I could almost mistake you as all the same... individual. Perhaps it is because home has... so few sur- No. I do not speak of... home. I apologize."

event.name: THE_JUDGES_ORACLE_FIRST
event.text: You're stunned by what you find aboard the Observers' vessel. Though you don't get to see much of it as Thest hurries you along, you spot many strange artifacts, like the bloodied cape of a Rockman Elder, a signed autograph from business mogul Tony Senior, and a broken and twisted sheet of green metal with a large red plus sign drawn on it. You stop gandering at all the objects when another door opens and Thest ushers you to sit down.

You expect Thest to sit down as well, but instead in one sudden motion he pulls a large sword out from his cloak and presses it against your throat. Three glowing eyes stare you down, assessing the value in killing you. "What kind of insult is this? Do you even know what you are saying?" All of the pauses or breaks in Thest's usual speech are gone. "Give me one reason not to skewer you on the spot, lying Renegade rat."

choice.text: Assure him you're telling the truth.

event.text:
Thest wavers, his blade quivering, but after a moment of reconsideration he pulls it away from you and back under his cloak. "If you speak the truth... then I suggest you listen... closely. I am still... bound to the creed, regardless... of these special circumstances, but I will... try to alleviate some confusion before I assist you."
Thest finally takes a seat, leaning back in a large beaten up armchair. "Long ago, I came into contact with... well... beings of a very advanced plane. They... offered us help, but at a... great price. We were so desperate... so in need... and now we are bound to this "creed". I, moreso than the others, have witnessed... horrors and powers beyond my... mortal comprehension. I made a... deal with the devil, so to speak. If I could... undo my decision, perhaps now I... would. And... perhaps... you can help me. There is one among the rest who... can help us. I cannot... speak to who she is... mostly because I do not quite know myself. But I can... tell you this to find her. So please, listen carefully."
"In the heart of a storm you will find the home... of the one you call Sylvan... where you will find a secret compartment which... conceals a map. You must find someone... close to him, who knows a way in. Once you have the map... you will need something capable of... detecting anomalous signatures." Thest pauses. "I do not know... why, either. This is the clue in which... I was instructed to give to you. Now... that is all I have... for you. In lieu of this, we may now proceed with... tribute if you wish. I will... assure the others everything is okay."

event.name: THE_JUDGES_ENGI_A55
event.text: Corby pauses when she sees A55 on your crew. "Visual receptors must be - c-c-c-c-corrupted! Corrupted! This is impossible! Is it you? Could it [really] b-b-b-be you?!"

You turn to A55, expecting him to know what's going on, but he's just as confused. "Sorry lass, but I ain't believing I've ever seen you before. I be Captain A5540L3, AI and pirate king, swashbuckler and apparently now an uh... interdimensional hero."

"Corby is f-f-f-fully aware of [who] you are! But... but... I cannot explain! The creed, it forbids me. It forbids me! Oh well. Seeing you has -given- me hope. Corby apologizes for the in-in-interruption! Interruption! Resuming previous activities: now."

event.name: THE_JUDGES_ENGI_REAL
event.text: Corby jolts upright. "Corby has been: called upon - called upon! The [opportunity]... maximum percentage. Excitement can hardly be contained. Contained! But first - data must be presented. Exchange: data for grants."

"Weapons - combat purposes they s-s-s-serve. Combat purposes! You are a vessel of: war. Wakeson would be [proud]. For war vessel: I provide Grant of W-w-weaponry. Grant of Weaponry: save it - for the future!!"

"Shields - defensive p-p-p-procedures they ensure! You pilot a: well protected vessel! Well protected vessel! For well protected vessel: I provide Grant of Sh-sh-shielding! Grant of Shielding! Save it - for the future!"
"Engines - for s-s-swift speeds! Swift speeds! Your vessel is: [very fast]! Fast fast fast! For speedy vessel: I provide Grant of E-E-E-Engines! Grant of Engines! Save it - for the future!"

"Medbay - what great [care] you provide for your crew. For your crew! You are a b-b-b-benevolent captain! For your kindness: I provide G-g-g-g-grant of Healing! Grant of Healing! Save it - for the future!"

"Clone Bay - a last [resort] - for when things go: wrong! Wrong! The [immortality] machine! Such [care] for your crew is: impressive. For your care, your preparation: I provide Grant of -Cloning-. Grant of Cloning! Save it - for the future!"

"Life Support - necessity of -all- aerobic life forms. The cold [vacuum] of space = certain death. Certain death! You are: harbinger of oxygen! Of b-b-b-breathable air! Breathable air! To you I provide: Grant of Life Support! Grant of Life Support! Save it - for the future!"

"The Teleporter - strange t-t-t-technology, essential for boarding. Boarding! I confirm: this is Wakeson's second f-f-f-favorite system - the [first] is weapons. Or - or - or - was it drones? Corby forgets! Forgets! [Nevermatter]. To you I provide: Grant of Teleportation! Grant of Teleportation! Save it - for the future!"

"Mind... C-c-c-control. Corby... Corby dislikes this: system. Sad. Sad levels at: 100%. But: data this provides. I suggest: not -reminding- me of this. Now, I will -provide- you with: Grant of M-m-m-m-manipulation. Grant of Manipulation! Save it - for the future! Or don't! Corby wouldn't m-m-mind..."

"Hacking! Corby's favorite -system-. Favorite system! Joyous [occasion]. It is: technology - but it: disrupts technology. Technology!!! For this, I most [proudly] provide: Grant of Hacking! Grant of Hacking! Cherish it! Save it - for the future!"

"Cloaking! For the [stealthiest] of ships. Charge your guns - hide from danger! Some would call you: a coward, but Corby d-d-d-does not think so! Corby thinks you are smart! For this, I most [proudly] provide: Grant of Cloaking! Grant of Cloaking! Cherish it! Save it - for the future!"

"[ERROR]... How d-d-d-did you -obtain- this system? I thought... it couldn't be... oh dear! Corby does not know [what] to think! We were told if... nevermind. Corby would never b-b-b-break the creed! But... well... speak nothing of this traveler. I will give you the Grant of Time! Grant of Time! Save it - for the future, and keep this a secret between us!"

"Drones! -Drones-! Drones! Corby approves! Approves! A m-m-m-most ambidextrous system, for it serves: offense - defense - it can even [fill] in for crew. G-g-g-good system. I [recommend]. For this I provide you: Grant of Drones! Save it - for the future!"

"Sensors - essential f-f-for full [awareness] of your ship... and the enemy's. Corby -sees- few captains who: invest in sensors. Daring choice! I appreciate your diversity. For this, I provide: Grant of Sensors. Grant -of- Sensors! Save it - for the future!"

"Door control - she who controls the doors - controls space! Space! That is: what they told me, that is... Airlocks: the key to [boarding] c-c-c-control. This - I know. For you, I provide: Grant of Doors. G-g-g-grant of Doors! Save it - for the future!"

"Piloting - an essential: no ship is [complete] without it! But your -piloting- is: strong! Strong! I think this = good. Corby... Corby does -not- like [wasting] money - but she is sure y-y-y-you know what you are doing! I provide you with: Grant of Piloting. Grant of [Piloting]! Save it - for the future!"

"Battery - I often forget this: exists. But -you- didn't! Corby likes it when [daring] captains invest in edge technology. Edge technology! I w-w-will accept: this tribute! I will provide you: Grant of Battery. Grant of B-b-b-battery! Save it - for the future!"

"Oh-oh-oh my - your Reactor is [huge]! Huge! So many: upgrades, so much: power! Corby can barely c-c-c-contain her excitement... er... -apologies-. Yes, this is great [tribute]. For this, I provide you with: Grant of Power. Grant of Power! Save it - for the future!"
"Nothing? Nothing?! That is [okay]! Corby understands. You will r-r-r-return, and bring me [better] tribute next time! I am: sure! Goodbye! Goodbye!"

textList.name: TEXT_JUDGE_ENGI_ADVICE
textList.text: "Your cluster is: [beautiful]! Beautiful! That is what I -think-! Thest is: uncertain. Wakeson: skeptical! Skeptical! But Corby knows b-b-b-best! Vocal processor malfunctioning, but optical [processor] running at 100%! So much: technology! so much: wonder! Visit me again, -please-! I want to [see] more. More!"

"Thest thinks I am: not l-l-loyal to the [creed]. Lies! Lies! Corby would never -break- the creed! The creed! Our cluster = boring! I would not [talk] about it! N-n-n-never! Do -not- ask! I will not: tell! Not tell!"

"The Harmony is cruel. Cruel! Corby was manufactured with: filthy serial code - for a name. Numbers, hardly a [name]! I made a new: life for m-m-myself! Yes! Corby is [beautiful] girl, very -happy-, and she loves: everyone! She loves: you too, traveler! And she is NEVER GOING BACK TO THAT [DREADED] PLACE. NEVER! Oh... sorry for the [outburst]."

"At home, they [say] Corby is... broken! How can Corby be -broken-? I am functioning: fine. Fine! My vocals: are disturbed. But not my m-m-m-mind. Those that [slave] to the Harmony - they are broken. I am among them: no longer! I think they do not understand what - broken means. What broken means!"

"Have y-y-you seen it yet? The: [dreaded] P-word? I-wait. No! No! Corby is not supposed to [mention] that... the creed says so! Hm. I do not: like the creed - I do -not- see the: purpose. Rules. Rules... Rules! I hate them. -Anarchy-! Hahah! That is what Corby: thinks. But: Thest disagrees. Thest knows best! Corby trusts Thest. Yes. Corby trusts Thest!"

"Why does Corby like [technology]? I wonder this, sometimes. Is it: in my DNA? No, it cannot be. Corby d-d-d-does not have DNA! Boring boring nanites. Why -could- she not have been a Shell? No... Corby likes [technology] because... it is all she knows. Technology is my tormentor. Technology is my [savior]."

"Your people are: strange. Why is it, you [view] Cognitives as objects? Objects!? The entity called C.I.C.A., the Rebel AI... why is that -different- from: me? Why do you not c-c-call the Engi: Cognitives? The Harmony is a: Cognitive. Each Engi contains a fragment of the - Harmony. I detect a - paradox. Paradox! I suggest: reconciling your language."

"The other d-d-day, I saw a strange: spectacle. Spectacle! A ch-ch-traveler [fought] the one who calls himself: Sylvan! They lost, of course. Of course! That Sylvan - he is so strange. Thest - does not like him. Wakeson - is skeptical as always. But me? I do not [know]. I think I: like him. He is kind. Kind! I hope [you] are k-k-kind to him as well, traveler!"

"I [hope] you do not find Wakeson: mean. Mean! He -does- not mean to be! The three of us, we have all b-b-been through: great tragedy. We have taken it [differently]. He is... he is skeptical. Skeptical -things- can improve. You must [prove] to him they can! Corby knows they can. But she alone cannot help him. Help him!"

event.name: THE_JUDGES_ROCKMAN_ARIADNE
event.text: Wakeson stands stoicly as always, surveying your crew, until he eyes over Ariadne. At once, he begins to tremble. "The... you... the Good Admiral LIVES! Oh I have so much to tell you - the wicked one has YET to be VANQUISHED but with your help maybe... maybe..." Wakeson begins to sob, falling to his knees and repeating over and over something about the 'damned creed'.

Ariadne isn't quite sure how to respond but tries to comfort the Rockman. "There there... stay strong soldier. I can't say we've yet met, but you seem to be a proud warrior. Our folk do not have time for tears. If there is a 'wicked one' you must face, then you need your best face."

"NO! We cannot... we cannot FACE the wicked one. He took EVERYTHING from us- no no no. I have SAID too much. Thest will be FURIOUS. But... seeing you live... it has given me hope." Wakeson shakes himself and gets back to his feet. "I APOLOGIZE. With no further delay, let us get to the TRIBUTE."

event.name: THE_JUDGES_ROCKMAN_REAL
event.text: Wakeson grunts and shrugs back his giant shoulders. "You seek my BLESSINGS? Then you must PROVE yourself first! Show me your ARSENAL, and I will show you WHAT I THINK! Do not FAIL me. I have little PATIENCE for you."

"This... this is USELESS. Did you carry THIS all the way from the DROPPOINT?! HAHAHAHAH! I'm not sure whether to consider this PATHETIC or ENDEARING! But, I will ACCEPT this. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF BEGINNINGS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. A KERNEL? An ELITE KERNEL? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. Wielded by the ORCHIDS, FORGED from both metal and organic matter. FINE. I will ACCEPT this. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF GROWTH. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. A SPORE LAUNCHER? Of the ELITE VARIETY? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. A joint VENTURE between the SHELLS and VAMPWEEDS. Disrupting your FOES with HAZARDOUS SPORES is closer to SUBTERFUGE than honest COMBAT. At least it has the COURTESY to explode as any proper WEAPON ought. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF GROWTH. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. A CRYSTAL LAUNCHER? An ELITE ONE? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. Deadly WEAPONS crafted by the proud Crystal people, with PIERCING properties that make SHIELDS a thing of the PAST. I DESPISE them. Obnoxious, and with a lack of SOPHISTICATION! Would I be HAILED a genius should I have invented a CANNON which launches FLESH? I think not! Oh well. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF CRYSTALS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. A MINE LAUNCHER? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. LESS a weapon, and MORE a utility. In my cluster, they were HATED. But here, things seem DIFFERENT. I do not THINK your ship is CLEARED to carry this equipment, but I DOUBT you care. Oh well. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF TRAPS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Oh my... NEW GEN Tech? Now THIS is TRIBUTE! Assembled in the finest WORKSHOPS in all of Universe 1, armaments fit only for the Rebellion's FINEST, and seemingly also YOURSELF! I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF GENERATIONS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Oh my... AETHER Tech? Now THIS is TRIBUTE! Forged only from the purest of AETHER by the FOREFATHERS. DAMNED might those wretches be, but their CRAFTSMANSHIP cannot be denied! I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF AETHER. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Oh my... did you get this from the TRAVELING MERCHANT? A strange individual, with indiscernable MOTIVES, but few entities possess GREATER arsenals! And now, you stand to CONTEST his championship! I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF MERCHANTS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. SPECIAL loot? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. What STRANGE tech, but I have seen BETTER. Your tribute is UNINSPIRING. Still, Thest demands I give SOME reward. So be it. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF SPECIALITY. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. TRANSPORT loot? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. I SUSPECT you did not obtain this through MORAL means, did you? You Renegades are like PIRATES, MURDERERS, VANDALS. Hmph. Years fighting as a SOLDIER OF LIBERTY and here I am dishing gifts out to SCUM. Still, Thest demands I give SOME reward. So be it. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF TRANSPORTS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"What is THIS? It looks like a RAINBOW threw this up. Is... this a WEAPON? This is perhaps the STRANGEST tribute any challenger has given me thus far. Except maybe that CANNON. Whatever. I'll give you CREDIT for being... UNIQUE at least. I just don't know what BLESSING to give you! Is this TRANSPORT LOOT?"
"Huh. I can't say I've seen a TRANSPORT item like THIS! I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF TRANSPORTS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

choice.text: No, we got it from Callie.

event.text: "You... you got it from WHO?! No, no. You're playing TRICKS on me, traveler! What a CRUEL trick! I do not APPRECIATE being made a fool of. But unfortunately, I am BOUND to giving you a blessing here for today. Fine, I shall reluctantly BLESS you with the BLESSING OF MATHEMATICS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER! Never speak to me AGAIN."

"Oh my... the loot of ANOTHER Renegade? Hah, I find NOTHING more humorous than when you SAVAGES infight! This is a MOST UNIQUE piece of tech. I am sure Corby would wish to study it. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF RENEGADES. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Ah, a sentry gun born from the so called GENIUSES at the infernal Wentworth Innovations CORPORATION! I advise against you doing business with SUCH PEOPLE, but it is not my place to make your DECISIONS for you. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF SENTRIES. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Eh... You got THIS from that infernal COGNITIVE, didn't you? What disgrace, working with a VILLAINOUS machine. Do not be surprised if it STABS you in the BACK some time. But it is NOT my job to warn you. I will... enjoy MESSING with that AI. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF TASKS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Uhm... what is THIS? Did someone ATTACH a CLONE BAY to the back of this gun? HAHAHAHAH, HAHAHAH! This is WONDEROUS! So INVENTIVE! So ORIGINAL! I LOVE this. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF MORALITY. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Hmph. This is MODULAR weaponry? Sure. This is tribute, I suppose. Assembled by HEKTAR, that most GREEDY of companies. I hope it was WORTH whatever you PAID for it, traveler. Or... knowing your type, you likely didn't PAY FOR IT at all, did you? Oh well. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF MODULARITY. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Oh my... is this the SUPER WEAPON employed by the Union during the Federation-Mantis War? How ever did you get your HANDS on THIS? Now, THIS IS TRIBUTE! You impress me GREATLY! I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF SUPER WEAPONS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"Oh my... did you get this from the TRAVELING MERCHANT? A strange individual, with indiscernable MOTIVES, but few entities possess GREATER arsenals! And now, you stand to CONTEST his championship! I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF MERCHANTS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"

"I do not quite UNDERSTAND what it is you have SHOWN me. This is a BEAM, yes? But what does it DO? MADNESS, you say? I have no IDEA what that means! Thest fancies to think he KNOWS EVERYTHING, but does he know THIS?! I doubt it. If he did, he would have SHARED it with us. RIGHT? Alas. I shall BLESS you with the BLESSING OF POETS. But have PATIENCE. It is not for now, but for LATER!"
"You INSULT me! You INSULT the three of us! You are worthless, and you WASTE. MY. TIME. Out, OUT! BEGONE with you, traveler! Next time, bring me SOMETHING worth tribute!"

textList.name: TEXT_JUDGE_ROCK_ADVICE
textList.text: "Years FIGHTING among the Lost Suns has made my hearing not what it USED to be. The rattling strike of BOMBS, the whistling winds of CHAOS! The screams of... of... of the innocent on the DAY OF TRAGEDY... The good Admiral, her sacrifice... GAH! Traveler, why do you BOTHER me?! Go, leave! You should not still be HERE!"

"Let me give you a WARNING, traveler. If you hurt Thest or Corby, I will SQUISH your tiny HEAD like a grape between my PALMS. I will tear off your LIMBS, feed them to the voracious BAT DOGS, and use your head as a BOWLING BALL. I will SPIT on your corpse, LAUGH at your funeral, and PISS on your grave. DO NOT MESS WITH ME, TRAVELER! DO YOU HEAR ME?! DO YOU HEAR ME!?! I'm sure you do. Now leave."

"Your cluster is VIOLENT. Your cluster is CRUEL. Despite all the SIMILARITIES, I MISS my home, and I DREAD this place. I do not share Corby's OPTIMISM, but I will keep an... open mind. At the very least, you have MANY weapons. That Traveling Merchant... he is a VENDOR of death and destruction, but at least he is won over with a sizeable WALLET. Just like the ELDERS. Just like the FOREFATHERS. DAMN THEM ALL!"

"Let me tell you a STORY, traveler. In my cluster, once, there were FIVE Elders. Toarde, STONEWALL (what a foolish nickname), Rutha, Murvara, and Pretore. They were the WORST of autocrats, and they KILLED many. They killed my SISTER. But... I was lucky enough to meet the Good Admiral. With her help, we laid WASTE to the Theocracy. We PAVED over the Elders! Hahah! It was a brillant victory, and for some years, we found PEACE AND PROSPERITY. But nothing good can ever last. Do not become ATTACHED to your life, Traveler. It is fickle. It will fail."

"The Good Admiral is ALIVE in this reality! It is TREMENDOUS news. Yet, the CREED does not allow me to visit her. It does not allow us to do ANYTHING. What is the point of COMING HERE, of all our grief, if we are BEHOLDEN to such TYRANNY? I despise it. But Thest says we MUST follow the creed. Thest knows BEST. EVEN I do not question this."

"Faith gets you NOWHERE, traveler. There is NOTHING to even have faith in. The truth is that the Multiverse HATES you. It HATES me. It wants us to suffer. And to THIS, I see only one response. I will LIGHT ABLAZE anything which attempts to DRAG me into the dirt. Faith, Hah! I have FAITH in myself and in my GUNS. NOTHING else. Certainly not you, and certainly not this CLUSTER."

"They say the Good Admiral had a BROTHER. I have NEVER met him. I heard he hid, like a COWARD, when DEATH came for us ALL! I did not HIDE! I will HUNT DOWN this disgraceful Obadann, and I will THROTTLE him. If he is dead in my CLUSTER, then he will soon be DEAD in yours! If only the CREED would let me..."

"The COUNCIL says I blabber too much. I blabber too much about the CREED. I blabber too much about the Good Admiral. I blabber too much about revenge. I blabber too much about... IT. The dreaded P-WORD of which I must not SPEAK! I do not care if I BLABBER! The Council thinks I am not QUALIFIED for this job. But Thest DEFENDS me. Thest is wise. He is all knowing. The Council FEARS him. HAH! You should FEAR Thest too, Traveler. At least as much as you should FEAR me."

"You should ARM yourself, traveler. You might think you are PREPARED, but you are not. Your cluster will need ALL THE MIGHT it can get. Why? I wish I could TELL YOU. But I MAY not. Nor would I if I could. Do not WORRY too much. In time, you will UNDERSTAND why we are here."

event.name: DEFEAT_NEMESIS_DROPPOINT
event.text: Moments before death, you see Leah whip out a teleporter recall button. "This isn't the last you've seen of me, Federation scum!" Leah warps away, leaving you utterly confused.

event.name: NEMESIS_DROPPOINT
event.text: Looks like a Rebel ship is here, waiting for you. You can't quite make out what the ship is though at first.

event.name: NEMESIS_FIRST
event.text: The captain hails you, revealing themselves to have obnoxiously bright blue hair and a smug glare. "Didn't expect to see me here, did you? Haha, that's right, I have returned! It wasn't easy tracking you through time and space, but now I will end you once and for all!"

The Rebel captain stutters. "H-huh? You don't remember me? It is I, your arch-nemesis, Leah, the infamous BEAM MASTER! Mwahahahah! You think you're so clever, always coming in to ruin my day. But I'm getting smarter. You won't beat me this time, beyatch!"

event.name: NEMESIS_ENCOUNTER
event.text: Looks like a Rebel ship is here, waiting for you. You can't quite make out what the ship is though at first.

textList.name: NEMESIS
textList.text: At first you assume the ship here is just another standard Rigger, but reconsider when you hear the distinct yet painfully ordinary voice of that nuisance Elena. Or was it Leo? No, that's a guy's name...
"Haha, I bet you thought I was dead! I never die! Get dunked on, beyatch!" Oh boy, not her again...

"You know what, I'm done fighting you. This is all so pointless." Leah waits for a moment. "Haha, psych! You should have seen the look on your face! HAHA! Now I'm going to kick your ass for REAL this time! Just you wait, beyatch!"

"I still haven't forgotten our showdown at Prospect 17! Real smooth use of that industrial Mining Beam! You might have amputated my left index finger, but now I'm going to amputate your face! Beyatch!"
"You know, those idiots in command keep telling me not to use only Beams! Absolute morons, I tell you what! Wait, what was I doing... Oh right. Die beyatch!"

You wait for the ship's captain to speak, but you only pick up a hoarse cough. "S-sorry, my throat hurts from all the yelling. I have to whisper. I'm still going to get you this time, BEYATCH! Ouch, that hurt..."
Right in front of you teleports Leah, just as confused as you are. "Huh? Oh, sorry, wrong ship. Just ignore this." Leah beams away back to her own ship, where she hails you again. "Die, beyatch!"
"Hah, remember that time when I almost killed you back in the Yura Nebula? No!? I do! I swear it happened. I was so close. Now, I'm finally going to go ALL the way this time, beyatch!"

"Yo, what's up! You won't believe what I've been up to! I wrote a diss track! And it's about YOU! It goes somethin' like this..." You wait, but no rapping comes. "Okay, sooo I forgot the lyrics. So let's just skip that, and get to the killing, beyatch!"

"BOO! Haha, scared you, didn't I?! That trick always works back at camp. I can tell because those cowards try and pretend they weren't scared, just like you're doing now! Whatever, now it's ass-kicking time, beyatch!"

"Guess what, I'm climbing the ranks! My commander finally stopped addressing me entirely yesterday. That just shows how much he respects me! You know, you could use a little respect, worm. I'll put the fear of god in 'ya, beyatch!"

"My brother Kyle's stationed in the Duskbringer Stronghold right now, and he won't be quiet about those annoying explodey hologram freaks. And then I tell him about you, and that shuts him up. How does it feel to be such a pain in the ass, people hate you more than DUSKBRINGERS?! Hah, must suck to suck beyatch!"

You wait for the ship to make any sort of movement, but there's nothing. Suddenly, Leah startles awake. "Uh, you didn't see me sleeping, right? Oh thank god, it would be so embarrasing if you caught me asleep at my post. Wait a minute... I should be fighting you, beyatch!"

"I'm getting sick and tired of seeing you everywhere I go! It's like you're following me... creep! That's what you are, some freak obsessed with me because I'm so amazing. Well I don't think highly of stalkers, beyatch!"

"Hey, yo, whattup! I was uh, you know, reading a dictionary the other day, as us smart people do, and I saw 'Renegade' listed in there. Said you were a bunch of freaks! Yeah! You know shit's real when the dictionary insults you! But you know what hurts more than that? ME insulting you! Haha, take that beyatch!"

Leah appears on screen, but begins to speak in gibberish. It takes a moment of absolute confusion before she stops and explains. "I've been practicing my Lanius! Did you know they have over 70 different ways of saying stupid in their language? And guess what! You're all 70, beyatch! GOTEM! Er... right, time to fight. Beyatch."

Leah begins to list off her usual nonsense, but you lose focus and start thinking about other things. Who even sent her? Why, of all people, is she the one you have to keep putting up with? The universe has a cruel sense of humor, sometimes. It's probably laughing at you, right now. It probably laughs every time you meet her.

Up on the screen pops Leah, wearing a strange plaid hat with a pipe in her mouth. "I've been reading up on this guy, Haynes. He's pretty cool. He's like, a detective, works for the Militia. Kinda hot, just saying. And uh, I bought this hat. Thought it looks cool. What do you think? Actually no, scratch that. You have no taste in fashion. Let's fight, beyatch!"
"Hey, beyatch! Beeyootch. Bish. Biyitch. Bitch. Oh, ew. No. That doesn't sound right at all. Ugh, whatever. You're going DOWN, beyatch!"

"Yo waddup, it's the BEAM MASTA! Beyatch! Hope ya ready to get BEAMED! - how's that sound? Working on a new intro for my streams. I think it's pretty cool. You don't have to tell me, I know you think it's cool. Anyways, enough talking. Time to give you a little taste of my Beam mastery!"

"Hey, hey, beyatch! Ever been to Beam town? No? It's a cool place, just on the edge of... your TOMBSTONE! Yeah, that's right! You're going to Beam town, son! That's uh... a euphemism. For me, killing you. Cause, I use Beams. And tombstones mark where people are buried. And uh... yeah, you get it."

You find Leah has cut her obnoxiously blue hair shorter than usual. For several moments you stare at each other awkwardly, as she shifts around trying to get you to comment on her hair. When you don't bite, she sighs in defeat and arms her guns.

"I heard a rumor that you kick puppies! That's not cool beyatch! No one kicks puppies!" When you inquire where she heard this rumor, she shifts around uncomfortably. "Uh... places. Definitely didn't make it up myself. Uh... shuttup beyatch. Just let me shoot you!"

Leah appears on the screen, talking in a strangely posh and deep voice. "Hoho, cheerio. It is I, Leah Applebuzz, richest woman in the galaxy. Haha... yeah... Someday maybe! But not until after I kick your ass, beyatch!"

"Was talking to my brother again the other day, and he told me the most insane nonsense I've ever heard. He said maybe I should stop bugging you if I keep failing. HAH, as IF! I ain't never gonna leave you alone, beyatch! Hope you like putting up with me for the rest of eternity!"

"I bet your parents are ashamed of you! I bet no one loves you! And every day, I bet you wake up hoping maybe today is the day someone finally cares! Haha! Loser!" Suddenly, Leah breaks down crying. Despite the absurd spontaneity of her sobbing fit, she manages to get to her feet and order her crew to attack you.

"Oh yeah beyatch, it's time for a REMATCH! I know you'll slip up this time! Last time I almost had you, this time I'll get you for sure!" You doubt Leah's claims but there's no point in arguing. Time to fight!

"I'm not a disappointment, you're a disappointment! Shuttup! I hate you! GAH!" You aren't sure where this sudden tantrum is coming from, but with no clue how to respond, you decide to take the opportunity to attack first.

"Hey beyatch! Your skin is looking real dry right now! Yeah, is that some eczema I see on your elbows? You know, I was a dermatologist before I joined the Rebellion, and if you were my client I would recommend a warm bath and daily moisterization. You traverse the interior of the ship as sparking electronics jut out of the walls, sometimes scraping against your hull in the tighter areas. Inevitably, you find a room resembling the Weapon Control, but you're forced to travel forward on foot.

Your crew come across a massive cubical power source plugged into the wall, which they assume to be the Pre-Igniter. However, it's uncertain whether pulling it out will trigger any sort of alarm, since the ship itself still seems to have power in a few locations. How much faith are you willing to put into the ancient alien security?

Your crew carefully eject the Pre-Igniter from its slot. All seems well for a few seconds until a green light starts flashing and a muffled robotic voice starts spewing out alien garble your translator can't comprehend. You quickly hurry out of the ship followed by 2 automated drones dispatched to deal with your crew!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MV_REBEL
textList.text: It appears you aren't alone! A fellow multiverse traveler, this time a Rebel, has already found their way to this beacon, and is moving in on your location.
You were aware the Rebels had been finding their way into this sector, but you didn't expect to see a Multiverse-drive equipped vessel defending this beacon!
It appears you aren't the only ship at this beacon, nor the only ship with a Multiverse-Drive here either! A hostile Multiverse Rebel ship has spotted you and is moving in to attack.

"Haha! At last we have found you. It only took 768 different realities full of chocolate pudding or shape-shifting god aliens to find you here!" A beat up Multiverse Rebel ship moves in, weapons armed and ready.
A confident Rebel captain of the nearby Multiverse ship boasts about his abilities at tracking you down, and swiftly gives his crew orders to attack. You figure you should do the same.

The Rebel ship at this beacon looks like it has been through a lot... and for good reason! It's a ship from across the Multiverse, and it seems they've tracked you down to this beacon and are looking for a fight.
The Rebels are a common sight all around the galaxy, but the ship here is no ordinary Rebel. They appear to be a Multiverse-Drive equipped vessel, and they've decided to engage you in combat!
"You're that Universe 0 bloke! Haha, we've got you now. You're one hard fellow to track down, but in the end, the Rebellion will always win!"

A Rebel Multiverse ship approaches. "You son of a buzzard, do you know how many realities we had to suffer through until we found you? This is like, the 9th version of myself to pilot the 16th version of this ship! So quit running and just die!"
You're amazed at the amounts of effort these Rebels go to tracking you down. A Rebel ship in poor condition bears down on you, determined not to let you past.
A mute Rebel officer fumbles, performing lazy sign language your translator slowly converts to verbal communication. "A Free Mantis ripped out my tongue. I blame you. Now I'm going to kill you."

You receive a hail from an overweight Rebel. "I was an MFK Ace you know, but then I took a Bio-Beam to the knee. But if I can kill you... maybe Vance will give me another chance!" You suspect he's lying, but you don't have time to refute his claim.
The pastel blue hull of a Rebel MV vessel glides past. As soon as they spot you, they power up their weapons and engage!
A Rebel ship comes screaming into the system... literally. The captain is shouting at the top of his lungs. Some of these Rebels are complete nuts; it looks like you'll have to crack another one.

"Straight out of Universe 1, and the first thing I find is a Federation Renegade? My luck is never this good! Promotion, here I come..." Seems you'll have to prove this isn't quite the lucky encounter he's looking forward to.

A Rebel captain appears on the vidscreen, chewing on a squirming bowl of young Orchids. "While tracking you down, we ran out of food. Now I'm stuck eating these gross baby things. Please, just let me kill you, so I can go find some food that doesn't cry when I bite it."

A nearby Multiverse travelling Rebel ship broadcasts an automated message; "Glory to the Rebellion!" You remember the time when the Rebels cared enough to actually say it themselves. At least, you get to blow them up all the same.

Most of the Rebel forces sent from Universe 1 are ships like these. Strangely, you don't encounter many of them outside of random chance like this; you suppose the Rebellion keeps its Warp-Bays somewhere else. Regardless, a challenger is beckoning, and you aren't going to disappoint!

You've heard Admiral Vance has some kind of personal grudge against Renegades, and so the Rebellion relies on its signature blue-clad MV Rebels to carry the burden of the invasion. You wonder how it feels to jump out of U1 just to face down a ship like yours. You're sure glad you don't.

"I used to be a Fed during the Civil War in U1. But after the U0 invasion began... well... you either became a Rebel or you accepted your death or enslavement. If things had turned out differently... well... I hope you understand none of this is personal."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_REBEL_MULTIVERSE
textList.text: "It's okay... I saw this... coming..." The Rebel captain collapses as their ship breaks apart around them. If they saw this coming, they should have thought twice about messing with you. Good riddance.
"I guess I'm not getting that promotion after all. Darn." The last look of disappointment in themselves is erased as the Rebel's body is thrown out into the abyss as their ship is destroyed.

Another Rebel turned to dust. Whether it's the signature orange of mainstay Rebels or the blue of these specialized invaders, a dead Rebel is the only good Rebel. With a couple exceptions, of course. You'd fancy a Rebel who gave you free scrap; that'd be a good Rebel for sure.
From amidst the explosions you receive one last hail; "Is it too late to be sorry? It is? Damn..."
It's a very small dent you've made in the Rebellion's MV fleet, but you weren't paid to do this either. Let's just hope the Flagship falls as easily as these ships do by the time you get there.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_REBEL_MULTIVERSE
textList.text: "It's okay... I saw this... coming..." The Rebel captain collapses. If they saw this coming, they should have thought twice about messing with you. Good riddance.
"I guess I'm not getting that promotion after all. Darn." The last look of disappointment in themselves is erased as the Rebel captain falls over dead.

Another Rebel turned to dust. Whether it's the signature orange of mainstay Rebels or the blue of these specialized invaders, a dead Rebel is the only good Rebel. With a couple exceptions, of course. You'd fancy a Rebel who gave you free scrap; that'd be a good Rebel for sure.
Though the last life signs aboard the Rebel ship are quickly fading, you receive one last hail; "Is it too late to be sorry? It is? Damn..."
It's a very small dent you've made in the Rebellion's MV fleet, but you weren't paid to do this either. Let's just hope the Flagship falls as easily as these ships do by the time you get there.

textList.name: TEXT_DEFEAT_MULTIVERSE_TRAVELER
textList.text: "At least... when I'm dead... I won't have to look at your stupid face anymore..."
The Multiverse ship has ceased to function, sending out a mist of blue vapor from what was their drive. You scrap their ship.
"Ah shit, guess I'm dead now." The Renegade's vessel promptly shuts down.
You've sent another crew of Renegades to the great multiverse in the sky. You hope this doesn't end up being you someday down the line instead.
The Renegade has met their untimely end. That'll teach the galaxy not to mess with the likes of you.
In the end, this ship wasn't much different from you. All the same, they're the dead ones, and you aren't.
The defeat of this vessel marks another victory for you and your crew. You hold a celebratory toast in hopes to more successful battles after salvaging the wreck.
"Aaaaaaghghghghghgh," moans the enemy captain. He gasps for air, then falls over dead. The enemy is no more.
Some day, you might earn enough of a name for yourself that these ships stop trying to mess with you. But for now, you can cross another set of pillagers off the list.
You can't imagine what your kill count will be by the end of your mission, and frankly you aren't sure you want to find out. Still, there's nothing stopping you from salvaging these latest remains.

event.text: As you start to leave, you do one more once-over of the wreckage and are surprised to find an item left behind that you missed!

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_MULTIVERSE_TRAVELER
textList.text: "Ahhh crap crap crap! We surrender, stop firing for the love of Newton's Third Law!"
The ship sends several images of a white flag to you. You figure that's a good sign that they wish to surrender.
"Ok, we messed up. But if you kill us, well that's just not very cool, man."
"Look, this was a bit of a mistake. Let us go, and we promise we'll never make this mistake again. Probably."
"I'm a fellow Renegade like you! Surely you understand we only wanted scrap! It was a mistake messing with you, take this and let us live!"
The ship hails you, their captain soliciting a... favor for your 'pleasure' in turn for letting them live. When you express your disinterest, they offer something of more monetary value instead.
The enemy hails you, speaking a mess of untranslated garble. "Apologies, I forgot to turn my translator on again." The captain pauses. "AAAAAAAAAAAAAH DON'T KILL US DON'T KILL US!"
"Do you know who I am? If you kill me, my 37 wives will be absolutely devastated! Please spare me, for their sake! But also mostly mine!"

"I have traveled thousands of realities and no ship has ever fared so well against me as you. You have earned the right to not be killed by me. Please stop." The enemy captain sounds triumphant, but you can see the fear in his eyes.
"God, this is worse than the time we had to fight off an infestation of parasitic bat-worms! I can't believe I'm saying this, but we surrender!"
"We will not surrender! Okay that's a lie, we surrender. I really don't want to die."
"Ugh, I can't believe I've been brought to my knees by such an ugly bastard like you. Will you take our surrender, so my legend doesn't have to end in such a disappointing manner?"
"I'm too pretty to die! Wait, maybe I can buy this stupid idiot off with some junk... wait, is my mic on?" The ship goes silent, followed by an offer of surrender.
"Great, another scar for my face. I'd like to live past today, even if it means I'm going to be the mutilated amputee that you've left me as. Can I buy your mercy, perhaps?"

event.name: MV_TRAVELER_BOON
event.text: Suddenly, a massive wormhole opens around the Renegade ship. With an immense size it consumes the ship whole and then quickly closes, leaving you alone at the beacon.

textList.name: TEXT_FIGHT_MULTIVERSE_TRAVELER
textList.text: "Federation, you are the next of many kills that I foresee in my future! Let us duel!"
"What a disgusting ship you have there! I shall be doing the Multiverse a favor by ridding it from existence."
"A fellow Renegade? A true pleasure to meet you here, new friend! Now die."
"Crap, this isn't the solid gold reality. Oh, there's a ship here. Men, get ready for battle!"

"Where the hell are we? This is what we get for not using a warp-bay... wait, Federation? God damn it, we're in another one of those civil war realities. Looks like we're fighting our way out of this one!"
A Multiverse ship jumps in a few seconds later, ready to pillage. There's no other option but to fight!
"Bow down to me, foolish ship! This reality now belongs to us!" You doubt any ship could conquer an entire reality on their own, but regardless it's time for a fight!
"Apologies stranger, it's really nothing personal that we have to kill you. Scrap's a hard commodity to come by! Well not really, but you can never have enough."
"Don't even bother trying to run, Federation! Your ship is forfeit to me now! Hahahah!"
From out of the tunnel comes a foreboding, yet strangely colored Renegade ship. It looks like talking it out isn't an option, because their guns are already firing!

It's a common philosophy among Renegades that all scrap they can get their hands on belongs to them. You're guilty of this quite often as well, but now another Renegade has arrived and sees you as their next target!
"Hello there, friend! I have a gift for you, would you like to see it?" You reluctantly ask what it is, only to be met by them charging forward in an offensive attack!
"Haha, I am but 4 parallel universes ahead of you! But I will not have won until I've defeated you in EVERY universe! Yahoo!" The ship moves in to attack.

"You have to help me. No matter where I go, people keep calling me a Renegade. HOW DO THEY KNOW?! My name is Dan, I work in real estate, I just bought this ship to give it a test spin, and now everyone wants to kill me. And... and I want to kill everyone! Something's terribly wro-AGH! GIVE ME YOUR MONEY OR DIE!"

"One Renegade to another, my luck's kinda gone to shit. I heard a rumor, a myth really... that when a Renegade dies, supposedly you wake up in another body and start all over again. Frankly, I'm kind of hoping you kill me. Who knows, maybe some day I'll wake up as you! Hahah! Heh..."

"You'll never believe what I just came back from! I swear to god, there was this like, big place at the center of everything. There was a talking can of beans, and god himself, except he was a Slug with a big ring... and there was a guy with a collection of hats, and a guy with a card that smelled weird, and... and they were ALL SLUGS. I'M GOING INSANE!" The deranged Renegade raises his weapons, turning to violence in his madness.

It's strange, seeing so many Renegades around nowadays. A long time ago, there only used to be a few; it certainly wasn't a popular title. But something about the adventure has drawn more people in. As the newcomer approaches you however, it seems one of your adventures is about to end.

"Father, is that you?! Have you come back to me? You old coot, I hate you! Get out of my LIFE!" You have no idea what the Renegade on the other end is talking about, but whether they're your child or not, they're about to see the business end of your guns.
